content: hope beanie antoniaelisabeth yarn 100 g andes by drops design 100g 90m needles 9 mm double-pointed or circular using magic loop size adult gauge 12 sts x 17 row = 10x10cm in stockinette on 9 mm needles about the pattern i came up with the pattern when i decided to knit hats for charity i am providing this pattern entirely for free in the hopes that it inspires others to knit a hat for themselves and/or a hat for charity - for example for a local homeless shelter pattern cast on 46 stitches using 9 mm needles and a stretchy cast-on join to work in the round place a stitch marker at the beginning of round or use the yarn tail from the cast-on as a guide *k1 p1* repeat ** in the round until your work measures 11cm from the cast-on edge *k all sts* repeat ** in the round until your work measures 26cm from the cast-on edge when your work measures 26cm from the cast on edge start working decreases as follows round 1 *k2 k2tog* repeat ** until 2 sts remain k2 35 sts remain round 2-4 k all sts´ round 5 *k1 k2tog* repeat ** until 2 sts remain k2 24 sts remain round 6 k all sts round 7 *k2tog k1* repeat ** to the end of round 16 sts remain break the yarn leaving enough tail to weave in thread the yarn tail through the remaining 16 sts remove the needles and pull tight on the tail to close the top of the beanie weave in all ends on the inside of the beanie abbreviations k knit p purl k2tog knit two together sts stitches
